intro: Savia zeylanica, commonly known as the Ceylon spurge, is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka and parts of South Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its latex contains compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
